questions.question: He died two months ………………………
questions.description: We use ago to count back from a present moment.

questions.question: She was clever ……………………………….. to solve the puzzle.
questions.description: Enough shows sufficiency. It goes after the adjective or adverb it modifies.

questions.question: I wish you …………………………….. behave like this.
questions.description: Would is used after wish to talk about people’s insistence.

questions.question: You ………………………….. be in trouble if she fails to recognize you.
questions.description: In the first conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: We ought to invest in health and education …………………………….. infrastructure.
I would rather be a writer ………………………… a doctor.
Tired ………………………….. she was she went shopping.
questions.description: As and though can be used after an adjective or adverb. In this case, they both mean although.

questions.question: …………………………………… she was tired, she went shopping.
questions.description: We use though to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: Such was her beauty ………………………. men from far and near came to woo her.
Strange ……………………….. it may seem, I don’t like music of any kind.
questions.description: As and though can be used after an adjective or adverb. In this case, they both mean although.

questions.question: If you marry me, I will give you ……………………….. freedom as you want.
She is as …………………………. nails.
questions.description: We use a positive adjective in the expression ‘as…as’.
